results.title: Modern times
results.brief_description: This was, in effect, the swansong of the Tramp in what is basically a ‘silent’ film which makes pointed use of synchronised speech at carefully selected moments. In a series of set pieces, in turn cynical and ironic, sentimental and nostalgic, Charlie unsuccessfully assumes a variety of occupations from assembly line worker to singing waiter. In between he becomes one of the unemployed, a willing prisoner and the companion of a working class girl. The film begins as social satire but Chaplin’s factory is too stylised to give the humor much bite. The film is ultimately more about homelessness than modernity. Chaplin’s political and philosophical naivete is disarming. His comic genius as a performer is timeless. Cast also includes Paulette Goddard and Chester Conklin.

results.title: Mo' better blues
results.creator_credit: Universal Pictures, 40 Acres and a Mule Filmworks and Spike Lee
results.brief_description: Award winning actor Denzel Washington gives a rivetting performance in Spike Lee’s breathtaking film about music and love. Talented trumpeter, (Washington), is obsessed by his music and is indecisive about his girlfriends Indigo and Clarke. When he is forced to come to the aid of his manager and childhood friend (Spike Lee), Bleek finds his world more fragile than he ever imagined. Stunning cinematography, a rousing score and superlative performances combine in an unforgettable feast of the senses. Also stars John Turturro and Wesley Snipes.

results.title: Mister Roberts
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Leland Hayward, John Ford and Mervyn LeRoy
results.brief_description: Hailed by critics as a classic of the American cinema, “Mister Roberts” is an adaptation of the smash hit Broadway play about life on a small naval cargo ship floating ‘somewhere between the Islands of Tedium and Ennui’ in the Pacific Ocean during World War II. Fonda is outstanding as the gentle cargo officer who protects his men from the shop’s tyrannical captain, played by James Cagney. Also in the cast is Jack Lemmon in his Academy Award winning role as Ensign Pulver and William Powell as Doc Daneeka.

results.title: Mississippi burning
results.creator_credit: Orion Pictures Corporation, Rank Film Productions, Frederick Zollo, Robert F. Colesberry and Allan Parker
results.brief_description: Gene Hackman and Willem Dafoe star as two FBI agents investigating the murder of three Civil Rights activists in a small Mississippi town in the early 1960’s. Parker drew on a real event for inspiration and this acclaimed film is tension filled. The violence and hatred which erupts from racial intolerance is a strong focus and is all the more shocking because it is endorsed and perpertrated by those representing the law. The excellent cast features Frances McDormand as the wife of the corrupt Deputy Sherriff, Stephen Toblowsky as head Klansman Townley and Michael Rooker who gives a chilling performance as the violent Klansman Frank. A strong point of the film’s script is the developing relationship between the two FBI men who come from different backgrounds with conflicting ideas. Their relationship evolves from mutual distrust to one of respect, and ultimately their combined forces enable them to reveal the truth about the murders.

results.title: Mission: impossible 2
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Wagner Production, Tom Cruise, Paula Wagner and John Woo
results.brief_description: Visually charged action-packed sequel to the 1996 original, “Mission Impossible 2”, directed by John Woo, has all the kinetic thrills expected from a master of the genre, but a simplified script leaves it strangely lacking in tension. Tom Cruise reprises his role as Ethan Hunt, the daredevil spy, who falls for a former flame of a spy turned bad. Hunt must rescue his new love, and save the world from a deadly virus. Supporting cast includes Thandie Newton (as the love interest) and Dougray Scott (as the villain).

results.title: Mission: impossible
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Cruise/Wagner and Brian De Palma
results.brief_description: Tom Cruise stars in this high action remake of the television series. The film is an action packed, gadget filled blockbuster with twisting plots, glamour and double crossing secret agents. “Mission: Impossible” is a big-production exciting spy thriller. Cast includes Jon Voight, Emmanuelle Beart, Henry Czerny, Jean Reno, Kristin Scott-Thomas and Vanessa Redgrave.

results.title: Miss Sadie Thompson
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Jerry Wald and Curtis Bernhardt
results.brief_description: Adaptation of W. Somerset Maugham’s “Rain”, a steamy story of sex, sin and salvation in the tropics. Set in the 1940s, it is the story of a bawdy nightclub entertainer, Sadie (Rita Hayworth) and Alfred Davidson (Jose Ferrer), a puritanical preacher waging an anti-sin campaign in the Pacific Islands. When Sadie falls in love with a straight-arrow marine (Aldo Ray), she seeks Davidson’s help in reforming her life. Tragically, the repressed cleric reacts with disbelief and, ultimately violence.

results.title: Miss Congeniality
results.creator_credit: Castle Rock Entertainment, Fortis Film, Sandra Bullock, Marc Lawrence and Donald Petrie
results.brief_description: FBI special agent Gracie Hart is a man’s woman - she chews with her mouth open, snorts when she laughs, has one eyebrow and is having a “bad hair decade”…So when the FBI needs to send an undercover agent into the famed Miss United States Pageant, Agent Hart certainly isn’t their first choice, she’s their only choice. Cast includes: Sandra Bullock, Michael Caine, William Shatner, Candice Bergen, Benjamin Bratt.

results.title: Mishima: a life in four chapters
results.creator_credit: Zoetrope Studios, Filmlink International, Lucasfilm, Ltd., M Film Company, Mata Yamamoto, Tom Luddy and Paul Schrader
results.brief_description: Poetic, fragmentary biography of Yukio Mishima (1925-1970), one of Japan’s most significant contemporary writers. Disturbed by the prevailing political and social conditions in the contemporary Japan he lead his own private army which upheld the ideals and virtues of ancient Japanese culture under the Imperial rule. He scandalised the world in 1970 when, accompanied by a few followers, he entered a military garrison in Tokyo, ‘captured’ a general, delivered an impassioned speech to an assembly and then committed ritual suicide (seppuku) by disembowelment. Beginning with a quasi-documentary view of Mishima’s last day, Schrader offers a carefully structured examination of his public, private and literary personas, to convey key points about his personality and philosophy. The author’s final, desperate act, intended to inspire national unity, is counterpointed with black-and-white sequences showing his childhood and adolescence, and with gloriously stylised colour dramatisations of scenes from his semi-autobiographical novels, “Temple of the Golden Pavilion”, “Kyoko’s House” and “Runaway Horses”. Together these strikingly different visual approaches convey the complex relationships between beauty, decay, art, and action which Mishima himself was preoccupied with throughout his life. Winner of three awards at the 1985 Cannes Film Festival for John Bailey’s cinematography, Eiko Ishioka’s set design and composer Philip Glass’s original music score ‘Mishima’ is a luminous vision of a man driven by sensual and intellectual passions. Cast includes Ken Ogata, Kenji Sawada and Toshiyuki Nagashima. Dubbed into English.

results.title: Misery
results.creator_credit: Andrew Scheinman, Rob Reiner, Castle Rock and Nelson Entertainment
results.brief_description:
He was a writer. She was his “Number One Fan”. She pulled him out of a car wreck, brought him home, splint and set his mangled legs. All Paul Sheldon had to do in return was write a very special book, just for her, all about her favourite character from his novels. One he had killed off and has to bring back to life. Now he not only has to write to save his character’s life, but he also has to write to save his own. James Caan is brilliant as the Gothic novellist who wants to change his genre and Kathy Bates, in her 1990 Best Actress Academy Award winning-role, is perfect as the obsessed fan who only wants to save her favourite character, even if it means killing the person who created it!
Cast also includes: Lauren Bacall, Richard Farnsworth
